name: indrik-spider

procedures: T1003.001::[Indrik Spider] used [Cobalt Strike] to carry out credential dumping using ProcDump.
T1007::[Indrik Spider] has used the win32_service WMI class to retrieve a list of services from the system.
T1018::[Indrik Spider] has used PowerView to enumerate all Windows Server, Windows Server 2003, and Windows 7 instances in the Active Directory database.
T1036.005::[Indrik Spider] used fake updates for FlashPlayer plugin and Google Chrome as initial infection vectors.
T1047::[Indrik Spider] has used WMIC to execute commands on remote computers.
T1059.001::[Indrik Spider] has used PowerShell [Empire] for execution of malware.
T1059.003::[Indrik Spider] has used batch scripts on victim's machines.
T1059.007::[Indrik Spider] has used malicious JavaScript files for several components of their attack.
T1070.001::[Indrik Spider] has used [Cobalt Strike] to empty log files.
T1074.001::[Indrik Spider] has stored collected date in a .tmp file.
T1078.002::[Indrik Spider] has collected credentials from infected systems, including domain accounts.
T1105::[Indrik Spider] has downloaded additional scripts, malware, and tools onto a compromised host.
T1136::[Indrik Spider] used wmic.exe to add a new user to the system.
T1204.002::[Indrik Spider] has attempted to get users to click on a malicious zipped file.
T1484.001::[Indrik Spider] has used Group Policy Objects to deploy batch scripts.
T1486::[Indrik Spider] has encrypted domain-controlled systems using [BitPaymer].
T1489::[Indrik Spider] has used [PsExec] to stop services prior to the execution of ransomware.
T1562.001::[Indrik Spider] used [PsExec] to leverage Windows Defender to disable scanning of all downloaded files and to restrict real-time monitoring.
T1584.004::[Indrik Spider] has served fake updates via legitimate websites that have been compromised.

description: [Indrik Spider](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0119) is a Russia-based cybercriminal group that has been active since at least 2014. [Indrik Spider](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0119) initially started with the [Dridex](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0384) banking Trojan, and then by 2017 they began running ransomware operations using [BitPaymer](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0570), [WastedLocker](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0612), and Hades ransomware.(Citation: Crowdstrike Indrik November 2018)(Citation: Crowdstrike EvilCorp March 2021)(Citation: Treasury EvilCorp Dec 2019)
